member.name: WS_MESSAGE_INITIALIZATION
member.summary: Specifies what headers the should add to the message.

member.name: WS_MESSAGE_INITIALIZATION.WS_BLANK_MESSAGE
member.summary: The headers of the message are empty.

member.name: WS_MESSAGE_INITIALIZATION.WS_DUPLICATE_MESSAGE
member.summary: The headers are initialized to be the same as the source message's headers.

member.name: WS_MESSAGE_INITIALIZATION.WS_REQUEST_MESSAGE
member.summary:
If using or WS_ADDRESSING_VERSION_1_0, then a unique message ID is set as the MessageID header of the message.
No other headers are added in the message.

member.name: WS_MESSAGE_INITIALIZATION.WS_REPLY_MESSAGE
member.summary: The ReplyTo header of the source message (an ) is used to address the message. The MessageID header of the source message is used to add a RelatesTo header to the message. If the message will contain a fault reply, then should be used instead.

member.name: WS_MESSAGE_INITIALIZATION.WS_FAULT_MESSAGE
member.summary: The FaultTo or ReplyTo header of the source message (an ) is used to address the message. The MessageID header of the source message is used to add a RelatesTo header to the message. This should only be used when the contents of the message will contain a fault.
